item.title: Vulnerability Allowed Scraping of 3.5 Billion WhatsApp Accounts
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Researchers demonstrated a now-patched vulnerability that could have been used to enumerate all WhatsApp accounts.

The post Vulnerability Allowed Scraping of 3.5 Billion WhatsApp Accounts appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Recent 7-Zip Vulnerability Exploited in Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit targeting the high-severity remote code execution (RCE) bug exists.

The post Recent 7-Zip Vulnerability Exploited in Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SolarWinds Patches Three Critical Serv-U Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
SolarWinds Serv-U is affected by vulnerabilities that can be exploited for remote code execution.

The post SolarWinds Patches Three Critical Serv-U Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks to Acquire Observability Platform Chronosphere in $3.35 Billion Deal
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
The move to acquire Chronosphere is the latest of several acquisitions in recent years and follows a massive $25 billion deal to acquire CyberArk.

The post Palo Alto Networks to Acquire Observability Platform Chronosphere in $3.35 Billion Deal appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Amazon Details Iran’s Cyber-Enabled Kinetic Attacks Linking Digital Spying to Physical Strikes
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Amazon threat intelligence experts have documented two cases in which Iran leveraged hacking to prepare for kinetic attacks.

The post Amazon Details Iran’s Cyber-Enabled Kinetic Attacks Linking Digital Spying to Physical Strikes appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Secure.com Raises $4.5 Million for Agentic Security
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The cybersecurity company has launched Digital Security Teammate (DST), AI agents that investigate, triage, and escalate incidents when needed.

The post Secure.com Raises $4.5 Million for Agentic Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Watch Now: Protecting What WAFs and Gateways Can’t See – Register
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Learn why legacy approaches fail to stop modern API threats and show how dedicated API security delivers the visibility, protection, and automation needed to defend against today’s evolving risks.

The post Watch Now: Protecting What WAFs and Gateways Can’t See – Register appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Mate Emerges From Stealth Mode With $15.5 Million in Seed Funding
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The cybersecurity startup will use the funds to expand its engineering team, extend collaborations, and get ready for enterprise rollout.

The post Mate Emerges From Stealth Mode With $15.5 Million in Seed Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Two-Year-Old Ray AI Framework Flaw Exploited in Ongoing Campaign
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Threat actors are abusing Ray’s lack of authentication to compromise exposed clusters and deploy LLM-generated payloads and cryptocurrency miners.

The post Two-Year-Old Ray AI Framework Flaw Exploited in Ongoing Campaign appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: AI Is Supercharging Phishing: Here’s How to Fight Back
item.dc:creator: Torsten George
item.description:
AI has given cybercriminals the ability to operate like Fortune‑500‑scale marketing departments—except their product is account takeover, data theft, and identity fraud.

The post AI Is Supercharging Phishing: Here’s How to Fight Back appeared first on SecurityWeek.
